content.question: Let <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be a polynomial function with nonzero coefficients such that <math alttext="f of x, equals, a, sub 0, plus a, sub 1, times x, plus a, sub 2, times x squared, plus a, sub 3, times x cubed, plus a, sub 4, times x to the fourth power " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>. <math alttext="T sub 3, of x " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is the third-degree Taylor polynomial for <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> about <math alttext="x equals c " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>c</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> such that <math alttext="T sub 3, of x, equals, b sub 0, plus b sub 1, times, open parenthesis, x minus c, close parenthesis, plus b sub 2, times, open parenthesis, x minus c, close parenthesis, squared, plus b sub 3, times, open parenthesis, x minus c, close parenthesis, cubed " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>b</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mi>b</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>c</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mi>b</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>c</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mi>b</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>c</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>. Based on use of the Lagrange error bound, <math alttext="f of x, minus T sub 3, of x " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> must equal which of the following?

choices.label: <math alttext="open parenthesis, x minus c, close parenthesis, to the fourth power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>c</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="a, sub 4, times, open parenthesis, x minus c, close parenthesis, to the fourth power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>c</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="4 factorial, times a, sub 4, times, open parenthesis, x minus c, close parenthesis, to the fourth power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>4</mn><mo>!</mo><mo>⋅</mo><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>c</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="a, sub 4, times, open parenthesis, x minus c, close parenthesis, to the fourth power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>c</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: Skill 1.F: Explain how an approximated value relates to the actual value.
